definitions: To hit a golf ball with the heel of the club, causing it to go sharply to the right (for a right-handed player).
To stab someone with a makeshift knife or sharp object.
To cut or prepare a piece of meat by removing the bone from the lower part of the leg.
examples: He shanked his approach shot into the water.
The prisoner threatened to shank his cellmate.
The butcher will shank the lamb leg for roasting.
